<p>
<a href="http://www.familytales.org/results.php?city=chicago" rel="city">CHICAGO</a>, Sept. 18, <a href="http://www.familytales.org/results.php?year=1867">1867</a>. 
</p><p>
MR. BRADY, Commission Broker, No. 609 
</p><p>
Broadway, <a href="http://www.familytales.org/results.php?city=new york" rel="city">New York</a> : 
</p><p>
I have this day sent to you personal property, which I am compelled to part with, and 
which you will find of considerable value. The articles consist of four camels hair shawls, one 
lace dress and shawl, a parasol cover, a diamond ring, two dress patterns, some furs, etc. 
</p><p>
Please have them appraised, and confer by letter with me. 
</p><p>
Yery respectfully, 
</p><p>
<a href="http://www.familytales.org/results.php?tla=mtl" rel="me">MRS. LINCOLN</a>.
</p>
